member.name: SERIALIZEDPROPERTYVALUE
member.summary: A range of memory of arbitrary type that represents a serialized structure. Programs should not inspect the contents of a SERIALIZEDPROPERTYVALUE; instead, they should manipulate it with the and functions.

member.name: SERIALIZEDPROPERTYVALUE.dwType
member.summary: Encodes type information about the serialized structure. Programs should not inspect this member directly; instead, they should use the function and inspect the vt member of the resulting PROPVARIANT structure.

member.name: SERIALIZEDPROPERTYVALUE.rgb
member.summary: A variable-length additional data that depends on the type passed in dwType.
